document.docAuthor: Tan, Ming Kai, Wahab, Rodzay bin Haji Abdul, Japir, Razy, Chung, Authur Y. C. & Robillard, Tony
document.docTitle: Nisitrus crucius Robillard & Tan 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the cricket genus Nisitrus Saussure (Orthoptera: Gryllidae: Eneopterinae) and descriptions of five new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the cricket genus Nisitrus Saussure (Orthoptera: Gryllidae: Eneopterinae) and descriptions of five new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
This species differs from all known congeners by the following combination of characters: frons yellow, with a cross-shaped black pattern above mouthparts; face part of fastigium between eyes black. Male FWs with a basal area generally paler; female ovipositor only about as long as FIII.
Nisitrus crucius
sp. nov. is similar to
N. brunnerianus
, from which it differs by smaller size and shorter ovipositor. It is also similar in size to
N. vittatus
and
N. malaya
sp. nov. but differs by female FW with cells on dorsal field mostly infumated black, gradually becoming yellow near CuA, M and R veins.
The species name refers to the dark cross marking on the frons (ʻ crucis ʼ = ʻcrossʼ, in Latin).
